formatted_address: Singapore, 淡滨尼北第1通道Blk 610号t01-02 邮政编码: 520610
name: Let's Grill Western Food 610

reviews.text:
Good place to use your cdc vouchers! The other stalls nearby accept it too.
The coleslaw and mashed potato are pretty good honestly, much better than you would get from some restaurants. My mother says she doesn't like the mash since it contains butter, but that's exactly what I like. The coleslaw is large and doesn't taste weird like it does in many places, it also doesn't contain a bunch of hard to chew thick stems. Very nicely cut vegetable threads, it's really easy to eat. The non sides? I think they are fine, I only tried the black pepper, or was it mushroom? chicken chop and the full moon burger. The minced beef in that had hard chunks, but honestly that's not too avoidable. I advise eating non minced stuff outside, especially if you aren't somewhere specially known for minced meat. Want to try the fish next time.
I forgot where my black pepper chicken chop photos are.
Anyway the staff are nice.

9oct `24.
Ordered Grilled Shimiji Chicken ($9), and added Lamb ($7). It was worth it. Chicken was succulent, and lamb tho 30% fat, was still worth it in portion. The lamb was marvelously smoked, even making the fat so tempting - I had to summon all my will against consuming it. And the sides were generously added. The corn was especially juicy, sweet and fresh. All in all, a most satisfying meal!
Had a ribeye steak medium rare ($17) and it was good. The coleslaw serving is generous too. Will come back!

Great western stall, really like the Indian guy and the Chinese guy who always wear a bandana. They make the food taste alot better with the kindness they show when taking orders. I appreciate them putting their effort to make the food taste good too!
My favorite order is Fried rice with fish/chicken.
Quite a big portion for the price. Delicious grilled chicken, for sides won’t recommend the coleslaw, got a weird taste like it’s refrigerated for too long.

vicinity: Blk 610 淡滨尼北第1通道, t01-02, 新加坡
